The wine produced in Benevento is highly regarded because of the unique combination of climate, soil, and grape varieties used to produce it. The region has a Mediterranean climate, with warm summers and mild winters, which is ideal for growing grapes. The soil in the region is rich in minerals and nutrients, which also contributes to the distinctive flavors and quality of the wine. 

Furthermore, Benevento is known for using ancient grape varieties, including Falanghina, Aglianico, and Greco. These grape varieties are unique to the region and have been cultivated for centuries, resulting in a depth of knowledge and expertise in their cultivation and processing.

The production of wine in Benevento also follows strict regulations and quality control measures, ensuring that only high-quality wine is produced and sold. This has helped to establish the region as a respected and reputable wine producer.

Overall, the combination of favorable climate, quality soil, unique grape varieties, and strict regulations has contributed to the high regard for the wine produced in Benevento.
